column4: I'va installed hoary on my laptop, but I can't suspend to ram; what can I do?
this is not uncommon. one of the only things we linux laptop users usually miss
you need to talk to crimsun, he has a good solution for you. a program 'alsaconf' is what i use to fix this problem, but only in debian.
in the meantime can you 'ls -l dev/snd/seq'?
ubuntu is just 'desktop debian'. can't compare them without including the application.
I haven't it, and in sndstat I have this :
what can I find in modules.conf?
all the aliasing mapping for devices and their system names/addresses.
but as i say, talk to crimsun. there's an 'Ubuntu way' for doing this, that he reccomends.
i would say it has something to do with 'modconf' or similar.
is there some doc, or wiki page about?
search based on the relevant part of your error in http://google.com/linux
hi, crimsun - it seems- is not here, do you know something about jachd and qjackctl?
